name: AstroLunch
tagline: Summarizes the topics we have discussed in the Astronomy Seminar (AKA AstroLunch@Uniandes)
body:
## Welcome
In this webpage we will keep track of the topics discussed (or to be discussed) during AstroLunch @Uniandes. We will meet up in Room Ip-101 every Friday at 1PM. During the first 15 minutes we will discuss the latest in the journals (Nature or Science) or any other interesting paper on the arXiv. In the next 40 minutes we will try to have 2 talks. One by somebody external to Uniandes and the second one by local students or faculty. The talks will be done on the blackboard, if you really need it you can use a couple of slides.

Ah! And this is Astro **Lunch**. Remember to bring your own lunch. We will **try** to have some pizza to share.

##Programme (2013-I)

### Week 1 (January 24)

* **A Vast Thin Plane of Co-rotating Dwarf Galaxies Orbiting the Andromeda Galaxy** http://arxiv.org/abs/1301.0446
* The rest of the seminar was spent explaining the mechanics for AstroLunch.

### Week 2 (February 1st )

* Paper **A black-hole mass measurement from molecular gas kinematics in NGC4526** http://arxiv.org/abs/1301.7184
* Frederic Courbin (EPFL, Switzerland). Expert on strong lensing. Some insights into his recent research
* Jaime E. Forero-Romero. [Projects on theoretical galaxy formation](https://github.com/forero/AstroSeminarUniandes/blob/master/projects/ForeroRomero.txt).
* Benjamin Oostra. [Project on solar rotation (using spectra)](https://github.com/forero/AstroSeminarUniandes/blob/master/projects/Oostra.txt).
* Santiago Vargas. [Project on solar rotation (following sunspots)](https://github.com/forero/AstroSeminarUniandes/blob/master/projects/Vargas.txt).
* Juan Camilo Buitrago. [Project on sunspot classification](https://github.com/forero/AstroSeminarUniandes/blob/master/projects/Buitrago.txt).

### Week 3 (February 8)
* Order of magnitude in astrophysics. The graphs come from the first chapter in the first volume of *Theoretical Astrophysics*, T. Padmanabhan, Cambdridge University Press.
* Paper **An outburst from a massive star 40 days before a supernova explosion** http://www.nature.com/nature/journal/v494/n7435/full/nature11877.html

### Week 4 (February 15)
* Camilo Pabón. Presented the paper **The Occurrence Rate of Small Planets Around Small Stars** http://arxiv.org/abs/1302.1647
* Juan Camilo Buitrago. Basics of Solar Astrophysics. [GOSA @ UNAL](http://www.observatorio.unal.edu.co/gosa/GOSA/Home.html)

### Week 5 (February 22)
* Danilo Gonzalez (OAN). Finding a place to setup an optical telescope in Colombia. Analysis from satellite images.
* Giovanni Pinzón (OAN). inding a place to setup an optical telescope in Colombia. Analysis from in-situ measurements of sky quality.


### Week 6 (March 1)
* Paper **A rapidly spinning supermassive black hole at the centre of NGC 1365** http://arxiv.org/abs/1302.7002
* Jaime Forero-Romero. The effects of gas rotation on the Lyman-alpha emission of distant galaxies.

### Week 7 (March 8)
* Jaime E. Forero-Romero. Fighting gender inequality in academy. http://www.nature.com/news/science-for-all-1.12535
* Juan Camilo Buitrago. [Observing the Pan-STARRS comet at Uniandes](http://fisica.uniandes.edu.co/index.php/es/noticias/168-cmeta-panstarss). 
* Sergio Silva. How to use spectra to measure stars' and galaxies' velocities.
* Benjamin Oostra. Understanding stellar spectra taken at Uniandes.

### Week 8 (March 15)
* **Deadline for the 1st report**
* Paper **The kinematics of the Local Group in a cosmological context**. http://arxiv.org/abs/1303.2690/
* Juan Sebastian Pérez. How to estimate the dark matter halo mass in the Milky Way: basic theoretical aspects.
* [Research opportinuties for undergraduates](https://sites.google.com/site/studpractice/)
* [Building the colombian network astronomy students (poll)](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1Y4DjYB-Bnw6SIhLE0NmmqoBQGAF260KDtXXdyHV_dH4/viewform)
* [Eventos colombianos en ciencias](http://eventoscolombianosenciencias.com/)

### Week 9 (March 22)
* Brigitte Pinto. Measuring the dark matter halo mass of the Milky Way.
* Ray Diaz. Basics about solar activity.

### Week 10 (April 5)
* Paulina Hoyos Restrepo. Medición de la rotación del Sol a partir de la Observación de sus manchas.
* Alejandro García. Escalas de distancias con variables cefeidas.


### Week 11 (April 12)
* Juan Camilo Buitrago. The Sun at high energies (X-rays).
* Santiago Vargas. [Solar Orbiter](http://sci.esa.int/science-e/www/area/index.cfm?fareaid=45) & [EGU](http://www.egu2013.eu/) & Pictures from Austria
* Daniel Lozano. Measuring the Sun's rotation with spectra.
* Nicolás Garavito. [NebulAtom Workshop](http://eventos.redclara.net/indico/conferenceDisplay.py?confId=184)

### Week 12 (April 19)
* Special Seminar: Isamu Matsuyama (Arizona). **Note different room: ML-513**

### Week 13 (April 26)
* Sergio Pedraza
* Nohora Galán
* Sebastián Velasco

### Week 14 (May 3)
* **Deadline for the final report**
* María Camila Remolina



##Grading

If you are getting credits from this seminar, you have to be graded. We will grade attendance (20%), class participation -give at least one talk- (20%) and a project (30% first report + 30% final report). The project can be anything from studying an interesting paper to dealing with a research project that might end up being the subject for your undergrad thesis.

##Contact
Jaime E. Forero-Romero (http://wwwprof.uniandes.edu.co/~je.forero/ email: je.forero) will lead the seminar during 2013-I. Contact him if you want to give a talk or know more about AstroLunch.
